meanings.definition: To silently articulate words while reading or speaking.
meanings.sent1: She was subvocalizing the text as she read.
meanings.sent2: I caught myself subvocalizing the words on the page.
meanings.sent3: He subvocalized the instructions to himself in a whisper.
meanings.sent4: Her lips moved slightly, subvocalizing the lyrics of the song.
meanings.sent5: Subvocalizing helps improve comprehension while reading.

meanings.definition: The act of forming words with the voiceless articulation of speech sounds.
meanings.sent1: Subvocalizing can aid in memory retention.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the concept of subvocalizing to the class.
meanings.sent3: The robot's subvocalizing was so quiet, it was almost imperceptible.
meanings.sent4: The subvocalizing of the wind through the trees was calming.
meanings.sent5: His subvocalizing was a unique way of communicating without sound.
